existing_custody_order.reasoning: Complaint expressly alleges a prior custody order entered May 15, 2019 awarding Plaintiff primary custody and Defendant visitation every other weekend plus one midweek (Wednesday) overnight.

specific_modification_sought.reasoning: Complaint identifies specific relief: eliminate the Wednesday midweek overnight; limit weekend parenting time (proposed Friday 6:00 p.m. to Sunday 6:00 p.m. with local pick-up/return); prohibit midweek overnights that cause missed/delayed or tired school attendance; permit reasonable phone/video contact and limited in-person midweek time not requiring early-morning travel.

material_substantial_change.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant moved ~90 miles from the child’s school since the 2019 order and continues the Wednesday overnight, resulting in long round-trip drives (child awakened ~4:30 a.m.), observable and documented ongoing fatigue, and a teacher-reported drop in participation on Thursdays — facts pleaded as a material and substantial change affecting the child’s routine and school performance.

best_interests_of_child.reasoning: Complaint alleges the requested modifications are necessary to eliminate repeated early-morning long-distance travel that causes exhaustion and impaired school functioning, to protect Emily’s health, safety and educational interests, and seeks temporary relief pending hearing — allegations connecting the requested change to the child’s best interests.
